September 2022 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Greetings! Hello, everyone. Welcome to our monthly newsletter, The Justia Insider. Are you getting ready for the changing of the season? September is a great month for a fresh start. Don’t miss the opportunity! Again, thank you for your commitment and involvement in our different projects. It is much appreciated. Throughout the year, everything has been turning out the way we planned. Let's keep up the excellent work!

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal

  • Law School Outlines Finally Posted! Check out the new look of our Justia Law Schools Center, which includes a panel highlighting our case law outlines. These cover 32 topics and over 2,600 cases.
  • Justia Supreme Court Site Updates. We completed roughly 50 pages for the redesigned Justia US Supreme Court center (which is still in progress), covering topics such as landmark Supreme Court cases, the history of the Supreme Court, the stages of a Supreme Court case, and the structure of Supreme Court decisions.
  • New 50-State Surveys. We wrote 50-state surveys on the cannabis laws and bankruptcy exemptions sections. These topics are currently relevant to consumers.
  • Additional Snippets. We have improved the accessibility and clarity of the Landlord-Tenant Law legal guide by writing more snippets underlining critical points in this area.
  • Federal Penal Code Update. Our team continues to update the resources available on the Justia Mexico Portal. Thus, we recently updated the Codigo Penal Federal section.

NEW TEAM MEMBERS

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Kevin Rodriguez

Intern IT team

I am a student who wants to gain experience as a full-stack engineer and travel the world. I have taken multiple Python, JavaScript, and other programming skills courses during college on my own. I am interested in companies focused on cloud technology that do their best to achieve people's growth. I am very keen on books like Mistborn and games such as Factorio.

JUSTIA PET NEWS

Sleepy Kiwi

Kiwi is a 12-year-old Chihuahua. She likes to nap a lot, sunbathe, and get her belly rubbed. Her favorite spot to sleep is Ale’s reading puff.

JUSTIA EMPLOYEE SPOTLIGHT

Stop Motion Summer Workshop by Manu Maldonado

Manu started a workshop for children and youngsters in a community in Cuernavaca, Mexico, to promote stop motion animation. The summer workshop will last one month and is suitable for children and teenagers from 3 to 15 years old.

TEAM ACTIVITY

Escape Room

People from our different teams took part in another edition of the virtual "Escape Game." The objective was to escape or find something hidden in each room in the shortest possible time. To achieve this goal, team members had to apply different skills. We appreciate your enthusiastic participation and commitment to winning. We look forward to seeing you in the next edition!

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Factfulness: Ten Reasons We’re Wrong About the World

Available on Amazon

"This is an eye-opening book. Hans Rosling will walk you through his experiences as a physician, researcher, TED-talk presenter, health adviser for WHO and UNICEF, and more. He will help you overcome biases and see the world with a clearer and broader perspective. He will also give you good reasons to be optimistic about the future of humanity. He will not give you hope, but data and facts."

- Priscila Martinez

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Erika Azuela, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta, and Jose Ramos
